intro: Pentalepis ecliptoides subsp. cucullata, commonly known as the hooded lily, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has strap-like leaves and produces clusters of fragrant blooms, often appearing in late spring or early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The subspecies is distinguished by its distinctive hood-like structure at the base of the flower, giving it its common name.
